title: Collecting data - fungus mixture and tree insect

content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Researchers are investigating the effectiveness of using a fungus to control the spread of an insect that destroys trees. The researchers will create four different concentrations of fungus mixtures: <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> milliliters per liter (<math alttext="m l/L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), <math alttext="1.25 milliliters per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.25</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2.5 milliliters per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="3.75 milliliters per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.75</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. An equal number of the insects will be placed into <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> individual containers. The group of insects in each container will be sprayed with one of the four mixtures, and the researchers will record the number of insects that are still alive in each container one week after spraying. (a) Identify the treatments, experimental units, and response variable of the experiment. Treatments: Experimental units: Response variable:

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Researchers are investigating the effectiveness of using a fungus to control the spread of an insect that destroys trees. The researchers will create four different concentrations of fungus mixtures: <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> milliliters per liter (<math alttext="m l/L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), <math alttext="1.25 milliliters per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.25</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2.5 milliliters per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="3.75 milliliters per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.75</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ml/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. An equal number of the insects will be placed into <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> individual containers. The group of insects in each container will be sprayed with one of the four mixtures, and the researchers will record the number of insects that are still alive in each container one week after spraying. (a) Identify the treatments, experimental units, and response variable of the experiment. Treatments: Experimental units: Response variable:
(b) Does the experiment have a control group? Explain your answer.
(c) Describe how the treatments can be randomly assigned to the experimental units so that each treatment has the same number of units.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
